summary: Completed testing of Blood Link demo data seeding and 'Register as Requestor' button feature. All features working correctly.
critical_code_review_comments: DonorLanding.js correctly implements 'Register as Requestor' section with data-testid='requestor-register-btn'
seed_demo_data.py uses 'approved' status for donors but UI displays as 'eligible' - this is correct mapping
Demo data seeding script needs DB_NAME environment variable to target correct database (bloodlink_production)
seed_data_creation: Demo data seeded via DB_NAME=bloodlink_production python scripts/seed_demo_data.py
context_for_next_testing_agent: Demo data has been seeded. Key findings: 1) 'Register as Requestor' button on /donor page navigates to /requestor/register correctly. 2) Demo data includes 15+ donors (status: approved shown as 'eligible' in UI), 10 donations, 25 components, 5+ blood requests, 20 requestors, 10 broadcasts. 3) Dashboard shows real inventory data by blood group. 4) Seed script requires DB_NAME=bloodlink_production to target correct database.

features_tested.register_as_requestor_button: ✓ PASS - Button visible on /donor page, navigates to /requestor/register
features_tested.demo_data_donors: ✓ PASS - 16 donors visible in Donor Management (13 approved/eligible, 2 pending)
features_tested.demo_data_donations: ✓ PASS - 10 donations created with screenings and lab tests
features_tested.demo_data_blood_requests: ✓ PASS - Multiple blood requests in various statuses visible
features_tested.dashboard_inventory: ✓ PASS - Shows real inventory data by blood group (A+, A-, B+, B-)

mocked_apis_list: Email/OTP service - logs to console only

notes: The seed script uses 'approved' status for donors but the UI correctly displays them as 'eligible' for donation. This is expected behavior - approved donors are eligible to donate.
